creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Mr and Mrs George Haldeman
description: grove of sparse pie trees, rocks, and a low, small hut with bamboo sprigs in background; small rock formation at far L, a few sparse pine trees at bottom; hint of a waterscape at R with boulders, pines, and a rocky shore at R; inscription ULQ; rectangular stamp with rounded edges, gourd-shape inside; mounted to maroon colored mat
markings: ULC, rectangular relief; on back, LRQ, in pencil: [Baiitsu]
signed: ULC: [ 梅佚 ] (Baiitsu);  ULC: [ 丙申葭月作与玉禅書屋　（？）] (1826, eleventh month…..)
title: Landscape in the Manner of Ni Zan
